channel.title: RuneScape Interface Editor/Emulator Release [Updated 9/26/10]
channel.description:
[B]This has been updated [u]6[/u] times.[/B] Hey everyone. Here's an interface editor I've been working on. It loads everything from the cache, but doesn't pack, so it's up to you to pack it manually or cut the loading from the cache and make it load the generated file.
[B]Controls[/B] -Left click - Select/drag a control, or emulate the clicking action in emulator mode -Right click - Context menu (Delete/Duplicate) -Middle click - Show hovering interface triggered in emulator mode
The emulator supports full config editing and displaying, along with certain mouse-interactions (Button clicking). Here's some screenshots and videos taken over the course of development (Thanks to Demetri for the GIFs).
[url=http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=69ko5f&s=6]http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=69ko5f&s=6[/url] [url=http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=293wq55&s=6]http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=293wq55&s=6[/url]
[IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2nc2ypt.gif[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/219pfmf.gif[/img] [IMG]http://img230.imageshack.us/img230/9673/selfull.png[/img] [IMG]http://img3.imageshack.us/img3/5175/fullscreen.png[/img] [IMG]http://img214.imageshack.us/img214/140/configsimulate.png[/img] [IMG]http://img20.imageshack.us/img20/7402/hovern.png[/img] [IMG]http://img94.imageshack.us/img94/8126/checkhover.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img221.imageshack.us/img221/6232/spell.png[/img] [IMG]http://img163.imageshack.us/img163/2167/editap.png[/img] Made in C#, meaning you must have the .NET Framework 2.0+ to run (Or WINE). If you downloaded it before the date of this topic edit, or the update count has increased, download it again as there was something I forgot about or added. [U][B][url=http://www.mediafire.com/?lzd2n2f42e8euf6]Download[/url][/B][/U]
Please let me know of any bugs you find. I am aware of the "UNKNOWN TYPE 8", and I have an idea of what it is, but it's not important. Oh, and after the release, I noticed the client doesn't ever load the offsetX/Y values, so it doesn't write them either. I'd highly recommend you [b]don't use these[/b].
[b]Update 8/4/10[/b] Fixed some bugs with adding things.
[b]Update 9/21/10[/b] Fixed the Model button.
[b]Update 9/26/10[/b] Fixed some stuff. Also fixed another bug on the second update.
~Lin

item.title: RuneScape Interface Editor/Emulator Release [Updated 9/26/10]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:110, topic:331282”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=427639.msg3513702#msg3513702 date=1298782795]

this dosent work on my comp… when i go to run it, it says" the aplication failed to initialize properly (0xc0000135)."

some versions of .net framework dont wory correctly with this tool, try getting an older version.

I could be mistaken, but wont this load the packed interface file without needing to load it from the cache as well? I forget the name since I hve been out of RSPS for too long, but I don’t see why you cannot use Tom’s Cache Suite to unpack it, and load it up on here. Might (not guarentee’d) solve your issue.
[/quote]

even if you open the file itself, you have to connect to a cache for the tool to grab sprites from.[/quote]
Aah, didn’t think about that one, guess I might reverse engineer this and see about adding selecting a folder to load the images from.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

My new project is to create the 474 equipment screen, everything was going smoothly until i got to the item group part, i recreated the item group for the equipment tab to the equipment screen 100% to what it showed in the parameters, but in-game it didnt show anything, not even the empty slot sprites, but when i duplicate the item group from the equipment tab it works. It seems like a bug to me as a parameter seems to be missing.

Read full topic

MediaFire

MediaFire

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.


Its still not working properly, i selected what i wanted to add the value to, Interface > Add VIA, after that when i clicked on the […] to edit my values, it crashed on me.

Well i managed to add it anyway, not by the means of strait forward though.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Interface Editor/Emulator Release [Updated 9/26/10]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:97, topic:331282”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=427639.msg3353537#msg3353537 date=1285552939]

Just out of curiosity, would anyone here donate money to me if I made this editor as good as my maker, in terms of design and simplicity? Kind of in need of money for real-life situations… And Badger, I’ll look at the bugs now.

ok thanks, i would definitely donate if i had any money myself. And i would love to have a more user friendly setup.
[/quote]Well, I know how to fix the VIA problem, but it’ll take a couple minutes. As for a fix to the other problem, make sure “DefaultTooltip” is set to false. This is changed and won’t be used unless the tooltip text is nothing in the fixed version.[/quote]

Ok thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Interface Editor/Emulator Release [Updated 9/26/10]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:96, topic:331282”][quote author=Lin link=topic=427639.msg3353533#msg3353533 date=1285552683]
Just out of curiosity, would anyone here donate money to me if I made this editor as good as my maker, in terms of design and simplicity? Kind of in need of money for real-life situations… And Badger, I’ll look at the bugs now.
[/quote]

ok thanks, i would definitely donate if i had any money myself. And i would love to have a more user friendly setup.[/quote]Well, I know how to fix the VIA problem, but it’ll take a couple minutes. As for a fix to the other problem, make sure “DefaultTooltip” is set to false. This is changed and won’t be used unless the tooltip text is nothing in the fixed version.

Read full topic
